abstract: Does the Obama campaign want the public to see Mitt Romney as the return of Don Draper (minus the drinking and womanizing)? Also, the Batman director worries that digital movie production has taken over, and details on Julian Assange’s new talk show.

lead_paragraph: Politico says it has found a thread in the Obama campaign’s framing of its expected opponent, Mitt Romney: comparing him to Don Draper of “Mad Men.” Not the drinking, womanizing or even charisma of Draper, Politico is quick to point out, but rather, in Democrats’ eyes, as “a hopelessly retro figure who, on policy and in his personal life, is living in the past.”

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Back to the ’50s in Politics, and Chris Nolan on Shooting in Film
